document.masterDocTitle: Reports of Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Galatheidae) from Chinese waters, with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Reports of Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Galatheidae) from Chinese waters, with descriptions of two new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Galathea
Fabricius, 1793
from Chinese waters

subSubSection.paragraph:
To date, 26 species of the genus
Galathea
Fabricius, 1793
have been recorded from Chinese waters, including the two new species and the eight newly recorded species herein. The Chinese
Galathea
species can be distinguished by the following key:

paragraph.keyLead:
- Rostrum sharp triangular; P 1 fingers narrow, distally spooned
.................................................... G. inflata
Potts, 1915

8 . Carapace with distinct transverse striae; Mxp 3 dactylus narrowed distally..
G. rubromaculata
Miyake & Baba, 1967

- Carapace without transverse striae other than median one; Mxp 3 dactylus truncate... G. k u b o i
Miyake & Baba, 1967
- No spine on anterior upper margin of the pterygostomial flap near linea anomurica ................................................ 10

10 . Carapace lateral margin with small but distinct spine between anterolateral spine and anterior cervical groove .........
.......................................................................................................................................... G. consobrina
De
Man , 1902
- Carapace lateral margin without spine between anterolateral spine and anterior cervical groove............................. 11

11 . Second transverse stria of carapace with spine near each hepatic region..................... G. ba lss i
Miyake & Baba, 1964

12 . Basal article of antennular peduncle with 3 well-developed terminal spines.........................
G. anepipoda Baba, 1990

- Basal article of antennular peduncle with 2 well-developed terminal spines, distomesial spine reduced to small size.
............................................................................................................................. G. yamashitai
Miyake & Baba, 1967

keyStep.keyLead: 14 . Carapace with numerous transverse ridges on dorsal surface; P 1 at least more than 2 times as long as carapace

subSubSection.paragraph:
including rostrum; P 1 fingers distally spooned.
.................................................................. G. multilineata
Balss, 1913
- Carapace with less numerous transverse ridges on dorsal surface; P 1 1.16 times as long as carapace including ros- trum; P 1 fingers distally ending in incurved spine
.............................................................................. G. sinensis
n. sp.
15 . Pterygostomian flap with spine on anterior surface.................................................................................................... 16

paragraph.keyLead:
16 . Mxp 3 carpus with spines on extensor margin ..................................................................
G. orientalis
Stimpson, 1858

17 . Carapace with marginal spinule between end of anterior branch of cervical groove and anterolateral spine................
................................................................................................................................ G. coralliophilus
Baba & Oh, 1990

- Carapace without marginal spinule between end of anterior branch of cervical groove and anterolateral spine........... ................................................................................................................................ G. oh sh im a i
Miyake & Baba, 1967

19 . Uninterrupted stria between anterior-most spines of branchial marginal directed behind anterior cervical groove......
.......................................................................................................................................... G. platycheles
Miyake, 1953

- No uninterrupted stria between anterior-most spines of branchial marginal directed behind anterior cervical groove.
.......................................................................................................................................... G. ternatensis
De
Man , 1902
20 . Gastric region with extra spines other than pair of epigastric spines ......................................................................... 21

22 . Carapace strongly pubescent; rostrum relatively broad triangular ..................................
G. pubescens
Stimpson, 1858

- Carapace hardly pubescent; rostrum very narrow triangular......................................
G. inconspicua
Henderson, 1885

23 . Carapace with uninterrupted transverse stria between anteriormost branchial marginal spines directly behind anterior cervical grooves
.................................................................................................. G. aegyptiaca
Paul’son, 1875

25 . Hepatic region with 1 or 2 dorsal spines; Mxp 3 merus with distal flexor spine subequal to or slightly larger than proximal spine
................................................................................................................... G. spinosorostris
Dana, 1852

- Hepatic region without dorsal spine; Mxp 3 merus with distal flexor spine distinctly smaller than proximal spine......
.......................................................................................................................................... G. tanegashimae
Baba, 1969
